text: تكاد السموت يتفطرن منه وتنشق الارض وتخر الجبال هدا

translations.translation: The heavens are all but rent apart and the earth split open and the mountains brought crashing down,
Which would cleave the skies asunder, rend the earth, and split the mountains,
It is such a monstrosity that heavens might well-nigh burst forth at it, the earth might be cleaved, and the mountains fall
This would almost cause the heavens to rent apart, the earth to cleave asunder and the mountains to crumble down in fragments,
The heavens are close to being torn apart by it, and the earth being split asunder, and the mountains succumbing and falling down.
Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains Hadda.
The heavens may almost be rent thereat, and the earth cleave asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces,
The heavens are wellnigh rent of it and the earth split asunder, and the mountains wellnigh fall down crashing for
Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins,
the heavens might well-nigh burst thereat, and the earth break asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces,
Well-nigh the heavens are rent thereat and the earth cleft in sunder and the mountains fall down in pieces. *Chapter: 19
The heavens are about to be rent apart at it, the earth to split open, and the mountains to collapse into bits,
At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains fall in ruins,
Thereby the heavens are nearly torn and the earth split asunder, and mountains fall crashing down
At which the heavens almost rupture, and the earth splits, and the mountains fall and crumble.
The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

[19:90] The heavens are almost (read takādu, or yakādu) rent (read takādu tatafattarna), by being torn apart (a variant reading has yanfatirna), because of it and the earth [is almost] split asunder, and the mountains [almost] fall down crashing, collapsing on top of them, because of [the fact]:
(Whereby almost the heavens are torn) crack, (and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins),

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { يَتَفَطَّرْنَ } معناه يَتَشَّققنَ




وقوله تعالى: { وَتَخِرُّ ٱلْجِبَالُ هَدّاً } معناه سُقوطٌ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: والله أيها المفترون على الله { لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمْ } بإثبات الولد له سبحانه { شَيْئاً إِدّاً } [مريم: 89] منكراً عظيماً، ومفترىً شنيعاً فظيعاً، إلى حيث { تَكَادُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ } ويتشققن مع متانة قوائمها وشدة التئامها { مِنْهُ } أي: من سماع قولكم هذا ونسبتكم هذه، هولاً ورهبة من صولة قهر الله وسطوة غضبه ونزول عذابه { وَتَنشَقُّ ٱلأَرْضُ وَ } كذا { تَخِرُّ } و تسقط { ٱلْجِبَالُ } خرور خشيةٍ وهولٍ { هَدّاً } [مريم: 90] أي: سقوطاً وأصلاً إلى التفتت والتشتت والاندكاك بالمرة، بحيث اضمحلت رسومها مطلقاً

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: قلت: { هَدًّا }: مصدر مؤكد لمحذوف، هو حال من الجبال، أي: تهد هدًا
